conversation.content: I need to... so basically I have to transfer my account to someone else.
Oh absolutely. Let me. Pull that up. Account number ending in 4782. What we're looking at here is... are you transferring to family member?
Sort of, I mean—it's my ex-husband actually.
Got it got it. Okay so. For account transfers. We need form TR-9042. Takes about 48 hours. Once processed. Both parties get confirmation at their registered emails.
I just... I can't really deal with forms right now, you know?
Mmm I hear you. Really do. Look what if I—actually wait. Let me walk you through this. Step by step. Make it simple as possible.
I think maybe I'm doing this wrong, I probably should've called earlier.
No no. You're fine. Honestly. So first thing. Need the new owner's email. That's it for now. Everything else we can...
It's, um... wait, let me find it... I had it somewhere...
Take your time. While you're looking. Quick note. There's a $15 transfer fee. Code CARE20 brings it to $12. Want me to apply that?
Yeah that's—sorry, I'm being so scattered, his email is mark.stevens at gmail.
Perfect perfect. Mark Stevens. Gmail. Got it. Now. Security question time. Mother's maiden name on file?
Thompson. Or wait—no that's... sorry, it's Miller.
Miller. Yep that matches. Account 7782-BK-4782. Shows active since 2019. Balance of $127.43. All getting transferred?
I guess? I mean probably. I don't even know what's on there honestly.
Hmm let's see. Three subscriptions. Monthly storage at $9.99. Premium features $14.99. Annual backup $47 due next month. Should I list them all...
Oh God, just... whatever, transfer everything, I can't—
Hey hey. Deep breath. Transferring everything now. Reference number TRN-8847-QM2. Mark gets an email. You get confirmation. Clean break. Done.
Okay. Thanks. Sorry for being such a mess about this.
Please. Don't apologize. Divorce stuff is. Hard. Really hard. Call if you need anything. Even just to check it went through. We're here.

scenario: asking about transferring ownership of an account
